paragraphs.text:
%md # TCPH-1 Walk Through In this notebook, we'll walk you through using the TPCH-1 data set, in these steps: * *1. About TPCH Data* * *2. Creating the Tables* * *3. Importing TPCH-1 Data From S3* * *4. Creating Indexes* * *5. Compacting and Collecting Statistics* * *6. Running Queries* At the bottom you will also see some graphical output from some queries (or slight variations).

The code paragraphs in this notebook all use the %splicemachine interpreter, which is pre-configured to interact with the Splice Machine with ANSI SQL.

## About TPCH Data TPC-H (aka *TPCH*) is a decision support benchmark. It consists of a suite of business-oriented ad hoc queries and concurrent data modifications. The queries and the data populating the database have been chosen to have broad industry-wide relevance. This benchmark illustrates decision support systems that examine large volumes of data, execute queries with a high degree of complexity, and give answers to critical business questions. ### The TPCH Schema Here's a view of the TPC-H schema:

msg.data:
TCPH-1 Walk Through

In this notebook, we’ll walk you through using the TPCH-1 data set, in these steps:

  • 1. About TPCH Data
  • 2. Creating the Tables
  • 3. Importing TPCH-1 Data From S3
  • 4. Creating Indexes
  • 5. Compacting and Collecting Statistics
  • 6. Running Queries

At the bottom you will also see some graphical output from some queries (or slight variations).

The code paragraphs in this notebook all use the %splicemachine interpreter, which is pre-configured to interact with the Splice Machine with ANSI SQL.

About TPCH Data

TPC-H (aka TPCH) is a decision support benchmark. It consists of a suite of business-oriented ad hoc queries and concurrent data modifications. The queries and the data populating the database have been chosen to have broad industry-wide relevance. This benchmark illustrates decision support systems that examine large volumes of data, execute queries with a high degree of complexity, and give answers to critical business questions.

The TPCH Schema

Here’s a view of the TPC-H schema:

paragraphs.text: %md ## 1. Creating the Tables Click in the next paragraph next paragraph to create the `TPCH1` schema and tables in your database:

msg.data:
1. Creating the Tables

Click in the next paragraph next paragraph to create the TPCH1 schema and tables in your database:

paragraphs.title: Create Tables
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
CREATE SCHEMA TPCH1;

CREATE TABLE TPCH1.LINEITEM (
 L_ORDERKEY BIGINT NOT NULL,
 L_PARTKEY INTEGER NOT NULL,
 L_SUPPKEY INTEGER NOT NULL, 
 L_LINENUMBER INTEGER NOT NULL, 
 L_QUANTITY DECIMAL(15,2),
 L_EXTENDEDPRICE DECIMAL(15,2),
 L_DISCOUNT DECIMAL(15,2),
 L_TAX DECIMAL(15,2),
 L_RETURNFLAG VARCHAR(1), 
 L_LINESTATUS VARCHAR(1),
 L_SHIPDATE DATE,
 L_COMMITDATE DATE,
 L_RECEIPTDATE DATE,
 L_SHIPINSTRUCT VARCHAR(25),
 L_SHIPMODE VARCHAR(10),
 L_COMMENT VARCHAR(44),
 PRIMARY KEY(L_ORDERKEY,L_LINENUMBER)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.ORDERS (
 O_ORDERKEY BIGINT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
 O_CUSTKEY INTEGER,
 O_ORDERSTATUS VARCHAR(1),
 O_TOTALPRICE DECIMAL(15,2),
 O_ORDERDATE DATE,
 O_ORDERPRIORITY VARCHAR(15),
 O_CLERK VARCHAR(15),
 O_SHIPPRIORITY INTEGER ,
 O_COMMENT VARCHAR(79)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.CUSTOMER (
 C_CUSTKEY INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
 C_NAME VARCHAR(25),
 C_ADDRESS VARCHAR(40),
 C_NATIONKEY INTEGER NOT NULL,
 C_PHONE VARCHAR(15),
 C_ACCTBAL DECIMAL(15,2),
 C_MKTSEGMENT VARCHAR(10),
 C_COMMENT VARCHAR(117)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.PARTSUPP (
 PS_PARTKEY INTEGER NOT NULL ,
 PS_SUPPKEY INTEGER NOT NULL , 
 PS_AVAILQTY INTEGER,
 PS_SUPPLYCOST DECIMAL(15,2),
 PS_COMMENT VARCHAR(199),
 PRIMARY KEY(PS_PARTKEY,PS_SUPPKEY) 
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.SUPPLIER (
 S_SUPPKEY INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
 S_NAME VARCHAR(25) ,
 S_ADDRESS VARCHAR(40) ,
 S_NATIONKEY INTEGER ,
 S_PHONE VARCHAR(15) ,
 S_ACCTBAL DECIMAL(15,2),
 S_COMMENT VARCHAR(101)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.PART (
 P_PARTKEY INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
 P_NAME VARCHAR(55) ,
 P_MFGR VARCHAR(25) ,
 P_BRAND VARCHAR(10) ,
 P_TYPE VARCHAR(25) ,
 P_SIZE INTEGER ,
 P_CONTAINER VARCHAR(10) ,
 P_RETAILPRICE DECIMAL(15,2),
 P_COMMENT VARCHAR(23)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.REGION (
 R_REGIONKEY INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
 R_NAME VARCHAR(25),
 R_COMMENT VARCHAR(152)
 );
 
 CREATE TABLE TPCH1.NATION (
 N_NATIONKEY INTEGER NOT NULL,
 N_NAME VARCHAR(25),
 N_REGIONKEY INTEGER NOT NULL,
 N_COMMENT VARCHAR(152),
 PRIMARY KEY (N_NATIONKEY)
 );

%md ## 2. Importing the Data From S3 We have pre-loaded flat files with the TPCH-1 data into an S3 bucket, to facilitate importing the data into your database. Click in the next paragraph to import all of the data from those files:

Importing this much data can take a few minutes; you'll see the result of each import displayed below the IMPORT statements as they complete.

msg.data:
2. Importing the Data From S3

We have pre-loaded flat files with the TPCH-1 data into an S3 bucket, to facilitate importing the data into your database. Click in the next paragraph to import all of the data from those files:

paragraphs.title: Import Data from S3

paragraphs.text:
%md

## 3. Creating Indexes

Next we'll create indexes for our table. We'll actually run three steps in the next three paragraphs in this notebook:

* Run the next paragraph to count the records in each table (without indexes), so you can what's been imported.
* Run the following paragraph to create four indexes.
* Finally, re-run some of the counts using the indexes and confirm that the counts are the same.

msg.data:
3. Creating Indexes

Next we’ll create indexes for our table. We’ll actually run three steps in the next three paragraphs in this notebook:

  • Run the next paragraph to count the records in each table (without indexes), so you can what’s been imported.
  • Run the following paragraph to create four indexes.
  • Finally, re-run some of the counts using the indexes and confirm that the counts are the same.

paragraphs.title: Run a Count on Each Table

paragraphs.title: Create Indexes
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine

create index TPCH1.O_CUST_IDX on TPCH1.ORDERS(
 O_CUSTKEY,
 O_ORDERKEY
 );
 
 create index TPCH1.O_DATE_PRI_KEY_IDX on TPCH1.ORDERS(
 O_ORDERDATE,
 O_ORDERPRIORITY,
 O_ORDERKEY
 );
 
 create index TPCH1.L_SHIPDATE_IDX on TPCH1.LINEITEM(
 L_SHIPDATE,
 L_PARTKEY,
 L_EXTENDEDPRICE,
 L_DISCOUNT
 );
 
 create index TPCH1.L_PART_IDX on TPCH1.LINEITEM(
 L_PARTKEY,
 L_ORDERKEY,
 L_SUPPKEY,
 L_SHIPDATE,
 L_EXTENDEDPRICE,
 L_DISCOUNT,
 L_QUANTITY,
 L_SHIPMODE,
 L_SHIPINSTRUCT
 );

paragraphs.title: Count Tables With Indexes

paragraphs.text:
%md

## 4. Compacting and Collecting Statistics

Since you've just imported a large amount of data into your database, it's a good idea to run a major compaction and collect statistics.

To do so, run each of the next two paragraphs:

msg.data:
4. Compacting and Collecting Statistics

Since you’ve just imported a large amount of data into your database, it’s a good idea to run a major compaction and collect statistics.

To do so, run each of the next two paragraphs:

paragraphs.title: Perform Major Compaction
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine

call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_PERFORM_MAJOR_COMPACTION_ON_SCHEMA('TPCH1');

paragraphs.title: Collect Statistics
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine

analyze schema TPCH1;

paragraphs.text:
%md ## Running the TPCH-1 Queries Each of the remaining paragraphs in this notebook runs one of the TPC-H queries, starting with Query 01 and through to the last query, Query 22. You can click in each query to run that query.

Although we include each of the TPC-H queries in this notebook, you may want to just run one or two of them for now; after you complete this course, you can always return to this notebook to run the other queries.

Note that the final two queries in this notebook are variations of Query 01: the first changes what is selected and how the results are presented, and the second demonstrates using an input field and variable subsitution.

msg.data:
Running the TPCH-1 Queries

Each of the remaining paragraphs in this notebook runs one of the TPC-H queries, starting with Query 01 and through to the last query, Query 22. You can click in each query to run that query.

Although we include each of the TPC-H queries in this notebook, you may want to just run one or two of them for now; after you complete this course, you can always return to this notebook to run the other queries.

Note that the final two queries in this notebook are variations of Query 01: the first changes what is selected and how the results are presented, and the second demonstrates using an input field and variable subsitution.

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 1
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 01
select
	l_returnflag,
	l_linestatus,
	sum(l_quantity) as sum_qty,
	sum(l_extendedprice) as sum_base_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as sum_disc_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) * (1 + l_tax)) as sum_charge,
	avg(l_quantity) as avg_qty,
	avg(l_extendedprice) as avg_price,
	avg(l_discount) as avg_disc,
	count(*) as count_order
from
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	l_shipdate <= date({fn TIMESTAMPADD(SQL_TSI_DAY, -90, cast('1998-12-01 00:00:00' as timestamp))})
group by
	l_returnflag,
	l_linestatus
order by
	l_returnflag,
	l_linestatus
-- END OF QUERY

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 2
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 02
select
	s_acctbal,
	s_name,
	n_name,
	p_partkey,
	p_mfgr,
	s_address,
	s_phone,
	s_comment
from
	TPCH1.part,
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.partsupp,
	TPCH1.nation,
	TPCH1.region
where
	p_partkey = ps_partkey
	and s_suppkey = ps_suppkey
	and p_size = 15
	and p_type like '%BRASS'
	and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
	and n_regionkey = r_regionkey
	and r_name = 'EUROPE'
	and ps_supplycost = (
		select
			min(ps_supplycost)
		from
			TPCH1.partsupp,
			TPCH1.supplier,
			TPCH1.nation,
			TPCH1.region
		where
			p_partkey = ps_partkey
			and s_suppkey = ps_suppkey
			and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
			and n_regionkey = r_regionkey
			and r_name = 'EUROPE'
	)
order by
	s_acctbal desc,
	n_name,
	s_name,
	p_partkey
{limit 100}
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 3
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 03
select
	l_orderkey,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as revenue,
	o_orderdate,
	o_shippriority
from
	TPCH1.customer,
	TPCH1.orders,
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	c_mktsegment = 'BUILDING' 
	and c_custkey = o_custkey
	and l_orderkey = o_orderkey
	and o_orderdate < date('1995-03-15') 
	and l_shipdate > date('1995-03-15') 
group by
	l_orderkey,
	o_orderdate,
	o_shippriority
order by
	revenue desc,
	o_orderdate 
{limit 10}
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 4
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 04
select
	o_orderpriority,
	count(*) as order_count
from
	TPCH1.orders
where
	o_orderdate >= date('1993-07-01')
	and o_orderdate < add_months('1993-07-01',3)
	and exists (
		select
			*
		from
			TPCH1.lineitem
		where
			l_orderkey = o_orderkey
			and l_commitdate < l_receiptdate
	)
group by
	o_orderpriority
order by
	o_orderpriority
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 5
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 05
select
	n_name,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as revenue
from
	TPCH1.customer,
	TPCH1.orders,
	TPCH1.lineitem,
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.nation,
	TPCH1.region
where
	c_custkey = o_custkey
	and l_orderkey = o_orderkey
	and l_suppkey = s_suppkey
	and c_nationkey = s_nationkey
	and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
	and n_regionkey = r_regionkey
	and r_name = 'ASIA'
	and o_orderdate >= date('1994-01-01')
	and o_orderdate < date({fn TIMESTAMPADD(SQL_TSI_YEAR, 1, cast('1994-01-01 00:00:00' as timestamp))})
group by
	n_name
order by
	revenue desc
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 6
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 06
select
	sum(l_extendedprice * l_discount) as revenue
from
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	l_shipdate >= date('1994-01-01')
	and l_shipdate < date({fn TIMESTAMPADD(SQL_TSI_YEAR, 1, cast('1994-01-01 00:00:00' as timestamp))})
	and l_discount between .06 - 0.01 and .06 + 0.01
	and l_quantity < 24
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 7
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 07
select
	supp_nation,
	cust_nation,
	l_year,
	sum(volume) as revenue
from
	(
		select
			n1.n_name as supp_nation,
			n2.n_name as cust_nation,
			year(l_shipdate) as l_year,
			l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) as volume
		from
			TPCH1.supplier,
			TPCH1.lineitem,
			TPCH1.orders,
			TPCH1.customer,
			TPCH1.nation n1,
			TPCH1.nation n2
		where
			s_suppkey = l_suppkey
			and o_orderkey = l_orderkey
			and c_custkey = o_custkey
			and s_nationkey = n1.n_nationkey
			and c_nationkey = n2.n_nationkey
			and (
				(n1.n_name = 'FRANCE' and n2.n_name = 'GERMANY')
				or (n1.n_name = 'GERMANY' and n2.n_name = 'FRANCE')
			)
			and l_shipdate between date('1995-01-01') and date('1996-12-31')
	) as shipping
group by
	supp_nation,
	cust_nation,
	l_year
order by
	supp_nation,
	cust_nation,
	l_year
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 8
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 08
select
	o_year,
	sum(case
		when nation = 'BRAZIL' then volume
		else 0
	end) / sum(volume) as mkt_share
from
	(
		select
			year(o_orderdate) as o_year,
			l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) as volume,
			n2.n_name as nation
		from
			TPCH1.part,
			TPCH1.supplier,
			TPCH1.lineitem,
			TPCH1.orders,
			TPCH1.customer,
			TPCH1.nation n1,
			TPCH1.nation n2,
			TPCH1.region
		where
			p_partkey = l_partkey
			and s_suppkey = l_suppkey
			and l_orderkey = o_orderkey
			and o_custkey = c_custkey
			and c_nationkey = n1.n_nationkey
			and n1.n_regionkey = r_regionkey
			and r_name = 'AMERICA'
			and s_nationkey = n2.n_nationkey
			and o_orderdate between date('1995-01-01') and date('1996-12-31')
			and p_type = 'ECONOMY ANODIZED STEEL'
	) as all_nations
group by
	o_year
order by
	o_year
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 9
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 09
select
	nation,
	o_year,
	sum(amount) as sum_profit
from
	(
		select
			n_name as nation,
			year(o_orderdate) as o_year,
			l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) - ps_supplycost * l_quantity as amount
		from
			TPCH1.part,
			TPCH1.supplier,
			TPCH1.lineitem,
			TPCH1.partsupp,
			TPCH1.orders,
			TPCH1.nation
		where
			s_suppkey = l_suppkey
			and ps_suppkey = l_suppkey
			and ps_partkey = l_partkey
			and p_partkey = l_partkey
			and o_orderkey = l_orderkey
			and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
			and p_name like '%green%'
	) as profit
group by
	nation,
	o_year
order by
	nation,
	o_year desc
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 10
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 10
select
	c_custkey,
	c_name,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as revenue,
	c_acctbal,
	n_name,
	c_address,
	c_phone,
	c_comment
from
	TPCH1.customer,
	TPCH1.orders,
	TPCH1.lineitem,
	TPCH1.nation
where
	c_custkey = o_custkey
	and l_orderkey = o_orderkey
	and o_orderdate >= date('1993-10-01')
	and o_orderdate < ADD_MONTHS('1993-10-01',3) 
	and l_returnflag = 'R'
	and c_nationkey = n_nationkey
group by
	c_custkey,
	c_name,
	c_acctbal,
	c_phone,
	n_name,
	c_address,
	c_comment
order by
	revenue desc
{limit 20}
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 11
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 11
select
	ps_partkey,
	sum(ps_supplycost * ps_availqty) as value
from
	TPCH1.partsupp,
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.nation
where
	ps_suppkey = s_suppkey
	and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
	and n_name = 'GERMANY'
group by
	ps_partkey having
		sum(ps_supplycost * ps_availqty) > (
			select
				sum(ps_supplycost * ps_availqty) * 0.0000010000
			from
				TPCH1.partsupp,
				TPCH1.supplier,
				TPCH1.nation
			where
				ps_suppkey = s_suppkey
				and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
				and n_name = 'GERMANY'
		)
order by
	value desc
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 12
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 12
select
	l_shipmode,
	sum(case
		when o_orderpriority = '1-URGENT'
			or o_orderpriority = '2-HIGH'
			then 1
		else 0
	end) as high_line_count,
	sum(case
		when o_orderpriority <> '1-URGENT'
			and o_orderpriority <> '2-HIGH'
			then 1
		else 0
	end) as low_line_count
from
	TPCH1.orders,
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	o_orderkey = l_orderkey
	and l_shipmode in ('MAIL', 'SHIP')
	and l_commitdate < l_receiptdate
	and l_shipdate < l_commitdate
        and l_receiptdate >= date('1994-01-01')
        and l_receiptdate < date({fn TIMESTAMPADD(SQL_TSI_YEAR, 1, cast('1994-01-01 00:00:00' as timestamp))})
group by
	l_shipmode
order by
	l_shipmode
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 13
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 13
select
	c_count,
	count(*) as custdist
from
	(
		select
			c_custkey,
			count(o_orderkey)
		from
			TPCH1.customer left outer join tpch1.orders on
				c_custkey = o_custkey
				and o_comment not like '%special%requests%'
		group by
			c_custkey
	) as c_orders (c_custkey, c_count)
group by
	c_count
order by
	custdist desc,
	c_count desc
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 14
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 14
select
	100.00 * sum(case
		when p_type like 'PROMO%'
			then l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)
		else 0
	end) / sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as promo_revenue
from
	TPCH1.lineitem,
	TPCH1.part
where
	l_partkey = p_partkey
	and l_shipdate >= date('1995-09-01')
	and l_shipdate < add_months('1995-09-01',1)
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 15
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 15
create view TPCH1.revenue0 (supplier_no, total_revenue) as
	select
		l_suppkey,
		sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount))
	from
		TPCH1.lineitem
	where
		l_shipdate >= date('1996-01-01')
		and l_shipdate < add_months('1996-01-01',3)
	group by
		l_suppkey;
-- END OF QUERY

-- QUERY 15
select
	s_suppkey,
	s_name,
	s_address,
	s_phone,
	total_revenue
from
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.revenue0
where
	s_suppkey = supplier_no
	and total_revenue = (
		select
			max(total_revenue)
		from
			TPCH1.revenue0
	)
order by
	s_suppkey;
-- END OF QUERY

-- QUERY 15
drop view TPCH1.revenue0
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 16
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 16
select
	p_brand,
	p_type,
	p_size,
	count(distinct ps_suppkey) as supplier_cnt
from
	TPCH1.partsupp,
	TPCH1.part
where
	p_partkey = ps_partkey
	and p_brand <> 'Brand#45'
	and p_type not like 'MEDIUM POLISHED%'
	and p_size in (49, 14, 23, 45, 19, 3, 36, 9)
	and ps_suppkey not in (
		select
			s_suppkey
		from
			TPCH1.supplier
		where
			s_comment like '%Customer%Complaints%'
	)
group by
	p_brand,
	p_type,
	p_size
order by
	supplier_cnt desc,
	p_brand,
	p_type,
	p_size
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 17
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 17
select
	sum(l_extendedprice) / 7.0 as avg_yearly
from
	TPCH1.lineitem,
	TPCH1.part
where
	p_partkey = l_partkey
	and p_brand = 'Brand#23'
	and p_container = 'MED BOX'
	and l_quantity < (
		select
			0.2 * avg(l_quantity)
		from
			TPCH1.lineitem
		where
			l_partkey = p_partkey
	)
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 19
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 19
select
	sum(l_extendedprice* (1 - l_discount)) as revenue
from
	TPCH1.lineitem,
	TPCH1.part
where
	(
		p_partkey = l_partkey
		and p_brand = 'Brand#12'
		and p_container in ('SM CASE', 'SM BOX', 'SM PACK', 'SM PKG')
		and l_quantity >= 1 and l_quantity <= 1 + 10
		and p_size between 1 and 5
		and l_shipmode in ('AIR', 'AIR REG')
		and l_shipinstruct = 'DELIVER IN PERSON'
	)
	or
	(
		p_partkey = l_partkey
		and p_brand = 'Brand#23'
		and p_container in ('MED BAG', 'MED BOX', 'MED PKG', 'MED PACK')
		and l_quantity >= 10 and l_quantity <= 10 + 10
		and p_size between 1 and 10
		and l_shipmode in ('AIR', 'AIR REG')
		and l_shipinstruct = 'DELIVER IN PERSON'
	)
	or
	(
		p_partkey = l_partkey
		and p_brand = 'Brand#34'
		and p_container in ('LG CASE', 'LG BOX', 'LG PACK', 'LG PKG')
		and l_quantity >= 20 and l_quantity <= 20 + 10
		and p_size between 1 and 15
		and l_shipmode in ('AIR', 'AIR REG')
		and l_shipinstruct = 'DELIVER IN PERSON'
	)
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 21(variant)
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 21-var
select
	n_name,
	count(*) as numwait
from
	TPCH1.supplier,
	TPCH1.lineitem l1,
	TPCH1.orders,
	TPCH1.nation
where
	s_suppkey = l1.l_suppkey
	and o_orderkey = l1.l_orderkey
	and o_orderstatus = 'F'
	and l1.l_receiptdate > l1.l_commitdate
	and exists (
		select
			*
		from
			TPCH1.lineitem l2
		where
			l2.l_orderkey = l1.l_orderkey
			and l2.l_suppkey <> l1.l_suppkey
	)
	and not exists (
		select
			*
		from
			TPCH1.lineitem l3
		where
			l3.l_orderkey = l1.l_orderkey
			and l3.l_suppkey <> l1.l_suppkey
			and l3.l_receiptdate > l3.l_commitdate
	)
	and s_nationkey = n_nationkey
group by
	n_name
order by
	numwait desc
{limit 100}
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 22
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 22
select
	cntrycode,
	count(*) as numcust,
	sum(c_acctbal) as totacctbal
from
	(
		select
			SUBSTR(c_phone, 1, 2) as cntrycode,
			c_acctbal
		from
			TPCH1.customer
		where
			SUBSTR(c_phone, 1, 2) in
				('13', '31', '23', '29', '30', '18', '17')
			and c_acctbal > (
				select
					avg(c_acctbal)
				from
					TPCH1.customer
				where
					c_acctbal > 0.00
					and SUBSTR(c_phone, 1, 2) in
						('13', '31', '23', '29', '30', '18', '17')
			)
			and not exists (
				select
					*
				from
					TPCH1.orders
				where
					o_custkey = c_custkey
			)
	) as custsale
group by
	cntrycode
order by
	cntrycode
-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 1 (variant)
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 01-variant
select
	l_linestatus,
	l_shipdate,
	sum(l_quantity) as sum_qty,
	sum(l_extendedprice) as sum_base_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as sum_disc_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) * (1 + l_tax)) as sum_charge,
	count(*) as count_order
from
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	l_shipdate <= date({fn TIMESTAMPADD(SQL_TSI_DAY, -90, cast('1998-12-01 00:00:00' as timestamp))})
group by
	l_shipdate,
	l_linestatus
order by
    l_shipdate

-- END OF QUERY

paragraphs.title: TPC-H Query 1 (variant with input field)
paragraphs.text:
%splicemachine
-- QUERY 01-variant with variable substitution enabled
select
	l_linestatus,
	l_shipdate,
	sum(l_quantity) as sum_qty,
	sum(l_extendedprice) as sum_base_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)) as sum_disc_price,
	sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount) * (1 + l_tax)) as sum_charge,
	count(*) as count_order
from
	TPCH1.lineitem
where
	l_shipdate <= ${maxDate='1992-07-20'}
group by
	l_shipdate,
	l_linestatus
order by
    l_shipdate

-- END OF QUERY

%md
## Where to Go Next

The next notebook in this class, [*Common Utilities*](/#/notebook/2DUK929SD), introduces some common utilities that you may find useful when working with Splice Machine.
